text:
Hi <@U01BM8QUSTS> & <@U01AGDAUB1S>! I wrote this little blurb for the Monday Memo. If you have a moment before noon tomorrow, could you take a quick look? It’s a bit general in my opinion, but I don’t want to make it too long either.. Anyway, I’ll take another look tomorrow morning as well, then if none of us have any better inspiration, I think this should do well enough :slightly_smiling_face:

Join the Open Science Student Support Group’s first session on *October 9th, 4-6pm*!

Students in the Open Science Student Support Group meet biweekly on Fridays to discuss and learn about different open science practices and support each other in implementing these practices in our own research.

Topic: Introduction to Open Science
Not sure what Open Science is about? Or maybe you do, but don’t know where to get started with making your own research more ‘open’? Join our first session to get an overview of different open science practices, why such practices are crucial for advancing psychological science, what the benefits and risks of these practices are and how you can start implementing such practices into your research! With lots of discussion and challenges of different difficulty levels, there will be something to gain for everyone!

Please join our Slack workspace or keep an eye on next week’s Monday Memo for further information!
